page.title: 17Longton High School
page.content: At Longton High School there are 1650 pupils,with almost 100 teachers, it is the largest school in Staffordshire.Suprisingly the school is situated in Meir.Previously the school was an all boys grammer school where pupils had to pass an 11 plus exam to gain entry. The first year pupils are housed in an annexe to the school which is almost a mile away from the main site.The rest of the school are located in a multi storey teaching block.In the 4th and 5th years of school pupils take an open option series of courses which lead to exams at either C.S.E. or G.C.E.level.
